name: Avoid using console.log()
description: The purpose of the rule is to detect the usage of console.log function. You can expose sensitive information, slowing down the browser or break workflow of websites if you let log statements in production code.
output:
Associated to each violation, the following information is provided:
- The number of violation occurrences
- Bookmarks for violation occurrences found in the source code
rationale: If read access is not properly restricted, then attackers can steal the sensitive information. If write access is not properly restricted, then attackers can modify and possibly delete the data, causing incorrect results and possibly a denial of service.
remediation: Do not use console.log in production code

qualityStandards.name: Leftover Debug Code
qualityStandards.description: The application can be deployed with active debugging code that can create unintended entry points.

qualityStandards.name: Information Exposure Through Log Files
qualityStandards.description: Information written to log files can be of a sensitive nature and give valuable guidance to an attacker or expose sensitive user information.

qualityStandards.name: Sensitive Data Exposure
qualityStandards.description: Many web applications and APIs do not properly protect sensitive data, such as financial, healthcare, and PII. Attackers may steal or modify such weakly protected data to conduct credit card fraud, identity theft, or other crimes. Sensitive data may be compromised without extra protection, such as encryption at rest or in transit, and requires special precautions when exchanged with the browser.

qualityStandards.name: Sensitive Data Exposure
qualityStandards.description: Many web applications do not properly protect sensitive data, such as credit cards, tax IDs, and authentication credentials. Attackers may steal or modify such weakly protected data to conduct credit card fraud, identity theft, or other crimes. Sensitive data deserves extra protection such as encryption at rest or in transit, as well as special precautions when exchanged with the browser.

qualityStandards.name: The application must generate error messages that provide information necessary for corrective actions without revealing information that could be exploited by adversaries.
